description: Gets a list of all grants for the specified KMS key. You must specify the KMS key in all requests. You can filter the grant list by grant ID or grantee principal. For detailed information about grants, including grant terminology, see Grants in KMS in the Key Management Service Developer Guide . For examples of working with grants in several programming languages, see Programming grants. Cross-account use: Yes. To perform this operation on a KMS key in a different Amazon Web Services account, specify the key ARN in the value of the KeyId parameter. Required permissions: kms:ListGrants (key policy) Eventual consistency: The KMS API follows an eventual consistency model. For more information, see KMS eventual consistency.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Use this parameter to specify the maximum number of items to return. When this value is present, KMS does not return more than the specified number of items, but it might return fewer. This value is optional. If you include a value, it must be between 1 and 100, inclusive. If you do not include a value, it defaults to 50.

parameters.name: KeyId
parameters.description: Returns only grants for the specified KMS key. This parameter is required. Specify the key ID or key ARN of the KMS key. To specify a KMS key in a different Amazon Web Services account, you must use the key ARN. For example: Key ID: 1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab To get the key ID and key ARN for a KMS key, use  ListKeys or  DescribeKey.

nested_items.name: KeyId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the KMS key to which the grant applies.

nested_items.name: GrantId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the grant.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The friendly name that identifies the grant. If a name was provided in the  CreateGrant request, that name is returned. Otherwise this value is null.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the grant was created.

nested_items.name: GranteePrincipal
nested_items.description: The identity that gets the permissions in the grant.

nested_items.name: RetiringPrincipal
nested_items.description: The principal that can retire the grant.

nested_items.name: IssuingAccount
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account under which the grant was issued.

nested_items.name: Operations
nested_items.description: The list of operations permitted by the grant.

nested_items.name: Constraints
nested_items.description: A list of key-value pairs that must be present in the encryption context of certain subsequent operations that the grant allows.

nested_items.name: EncryptionContextSubset
nested_items.description: A list of key-value pairs that must be included in the encryption context of the cryptographic operation request. The grant allows the cryptographic operation only when the encryption context in the request includes the key-value pairs specified in this constraint, although it can include additional key-value pairs.

nested_items.name: EncryptionContextEquals
nested_items.description: A list of key-value pairs that must match the encryption context in the cryptographic operation request. The grant allows the operation only when the encryption context in the request is the same as the encryption context specified in this constraint.

nested_items.name: NextMarker
nested_items.description: When Truncated is true, this element is present and contains the value to use for the Marker parameter in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: Truncated
nested_items.description: A flag that indicates whether there are more items in the list. When this value is true, the list in this response is truncated. To get more items, pass the value of the NextMarker element in this response to the Marker parameter in a subsequent request.
